abstract: Nepal's Parliament elects country’s first female president, Bidhya Devi Bhandari, who had pushed for new Constitution to require a woman be either president or vice-president.
lead_paragraph: Bidhya Devi Bhandari, 54, the deputy leader of the Communist Party of Nepal Unified Marxist-Leninist, had lobbied actively for a new Constitution.

headline.main: Nepal: Lawmakers Elect Nation’s First Woman President
headline.print_headline: Asia; Nepal: Lawmakers Elect Nation’s First Female President

snippet: Bidhya Devi Bhandari, 54, the deputy leader of the Communist Party of Nepal Unified Marxist-Leninist, had lobbied actively for a new Constitution.
